comment: This was a very interesting class, and super straight to the point. The professor did a good job of teaching these difficult topics and tried his best to be personable/ inclusive toward all students. Bi-weekly papers cover all the content (250+ words about videos/ readings, 200+ about 5 lecture points, and 250+ self reflection). All due Saturday.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Bi-weekly reflections due that include readings, watching, videos, a self reflection, and lecture points. Attendance is not mandatory but needed for lecture points in the reflection. Very sweet professor and outlines assignment expectations in the syllabus. Assignments are due on Saturday though :(

His lectures are very interactive one of the first professors that kept me engaged. I enjoyed this class and the way that he teaches. Drops the lowest quiz grade and there isn't any hw, just quizzes and a midterm and final. Attendance isn't made but I'd recommend going to lectures. No lockdown browser or cam required.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Easy as it gets! he is so caring about his students and is very knowledgeable about human services if you plan on going into that. You will have 4 quizzes, a midterm, and final. That's it! Easy if you look at the lecture slides. No lockdown browser. He is always available to outside of class if you need him very quick to respond. Take Skott-Myhre!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: omg best professor ever. only a few papers due for the entire semester which were 700 words but very easy to do. slightly hard grader but everything is self explanatory.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He takes the self-reflections pretty seriously, so make sure you follow the directions. I didn't go to class cause all of the assignments were online, but he's a nice professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: His lectures were very boring. You are only graded by "reflections" that are 700 words and are due every other week. Super easy, just time-consuming. I either left class 30 minutes early or just did not go, and I made an A. Make sure not to submit your work early because he will mark off points for "missing the lecture". Easy A
this class was super easy and I loved listening to his lectures he's very knowledgable and it awoken a new passion in me, only three quizzes and a final

This class was very easy. The only thing we have is tests that are easy and straightforward. The notes are very difficult to understand sometimes but you can work around it. He takes attendance randomly but not often. The professor is kinda dry when teaching but it's an easy class.

He takes attendance randomly 5 times throughout the semester that are worth 10 points of your overall grade which either makes or breaks your grade. His exams and quizzes are easy and do not have webcam.

Dr Hans Skott is by far one of the best. He does lecture heavy but he will go lengths to make sure you succeed.  He is the most laid back, caring professor I've ever had. You don't have homework.  Just open book quizzes.  10/10 work recommended.

I got an A, but coming to class is nonnegotiable with this one. He grades attendance randomly a few times a semester, and his quizzes and tests are based exclusively on what he says in class so if you don't show up there's really no way to pass. He's a great professor, but don't take him if you don't have a good track record with attendance.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: So chill, so cool, and very entertaining. Talks about such intresting topics. Test are based on lecture so its not necessarily required to go, but you should. Reflections are an easy 100 as long as you follow the outline and show up to class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: He's a very easy professor. The weekly reflections are simple and can be completed in about 30 mins. The course content is very interesting and you can tell he really cares about the topics.

Literally one of my favorite professors. If you attend class and write the reflections on time you will pass. Make sure you participate in class discussions because they can help you in the end. He is so caring and knows how to cater to his students.

Dr. Hans was great. There were 1-to-2-page reflections due every 2 weeks on readings, videos and lectures so attend class because his power points don't cover what he's expecting in your reflection. You will come together in groups to share reflections and attendance is taken. Reflections and 2 exams are all that you're graded on. Pretty easy
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: He is super knowledgeable and experienced in his field. I only had some difficulty because his quizzes/midterm/final are largely based on what he SAYS not what is on the ppt. Ask questions and he will clarify. Attend class and its and easy A
He is the best professor in the department. His lectures are kinda boring but worth to listen. He is very experienced in the field and very considerate of his students.

It is a lecture heavy class, but also he only gives 3 quizzes, a midterm, and a final. There is not a lot of room for mistakes in this class, but his lectures are amazing and he genuinely cares about the class and students. The midterm he gave us had poorly written questions, but the final was much better. If you can take good notes you will be ok.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: He is easy to communicate with and is understanding. You can tell he cares about what he is teaching, as he is able to turn sparsely worded slides (a con) into a whole eye-opening lecture, and he has many inspiring and thoughtful works published across the web. 8 reflections based on readings and mid/final are 100% based on lecture so go to class.

Easily class, reflections every two weeks. Midterm and final are based on the lectures and the videos in the lecture. Whenever we have reflections due we sit in random groups and pick one spokesperson to share with the class.
Loved this class! Wonderful professor. He is funny and very inclusive. TAKE HIM! Easy A
Pretty cool professor! I really like this class, show up and you'll pass the class. Attendance is a grade and the tests and quizzes contain information he talks about in class.
This was the only class I looked forward to all semester. Professor Hans is one of those teachers who you can tell genuinely cares about not only the course material but his students as well.
Easiest. Class. Ever. 1-2 page papers every 2 weeks and attendance is your entire grade. And trust me you dont have to be an amazing writer to get 100s on the papers either. Take him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: This Professor is Amazing. I enjoyed every lecture. No test just a 1-2 page paper every 2 weeks

By far the best professor I've had at KSU. His lectures are inspirational and really make you think. It's not an easy A, but he provides clear instructions and is easy to reach outside of class if you need help. He genuinely wants his students to succeed. Be warned, his lectures are not dumbed down and you have to work for it!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Lectures were entertaining and really made you think about the material. Grades were attendance (he's very understanding if you miss class, though), 3 quizzes, the midterm, and the final. All tests were very straightforward and he's easy to reach if you need help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Hans was great! The online lectures were pretty long but honestly I would clean my room, do my hair, etc while he was talking - you don't need to listen too intensely. As long as you turn in your work (only a 1 page paper every/every other week) and log into lecture, you will get a 100. He is also very compassionate and interesting!

First off please take Dr. Hans!! He is great. You must be present to all lectures because they are 20% of your grade. I took him online. But not too long. There are like one or two readings every week that pertain to the reflections due. The reflections arent hard at all if you are able to write easily. Paper 1-1/2 pages. I received an A!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: I took this course online, and he was very lecture heavy. However, if you pay attention to lecture than the class is easy. Tests and quizzes are straight off the textbook/lecture, and he also makes sure students understand the lecture as he goes. He definitely cares about his students, so if you have any concerns you can always reach out!

I took professor Hans for human services. He is an alright professor I just think that sometimes he lets his own political views impact how he teaches certain things to us. If you are one of the few conservative students at KSU, you might want to take this class with somebody else. Other than that, quizzes are not too difficult if you have the PPTS
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Skott-Myhres Cultural Competency course really inspired me to think about the impact I want to make in healthcare from a cultural perspective. The only grades in the class were attendance and eight 1-1/2 page-long reflection essays which pertained to the lectures and the reading. If you engage with the topics meaningfully, youll do well.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Professor Skott- Myhre's class was extremely enjoyable. I had him for HS 2100 and I enjoyed every bit of it. He is one of the best teachers at Kennesaw State University by far. Dr. Skott- Myhre is extremely well- versed in his field and I wish I could take more of his classes. Take him if you get the chance!!

Dr. Skott-Myhre is a wise guy. Rather quiet and full of experience in the field. He writes his own lectures so you don't need the textbook. We had a handful of quizzes throughout the semester, along with a midterm and final. Show up to class, take notes and pay attention and you'll be fine. Quizlet is a helpful tool in his class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: As a person, I am sure he is great. He seems very knowledgeable and cares about his students. As a professor, I didn't get much out of the class. I am not sure how I even passed the class- barely any information from the lectures were on the test. The tests were not easy and that's what the class was made up of. Would NOT recommend!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: SUPER engaging class with a really easy-going professor. He made the class interesting, relevant to the major, and really stress-free. This is the second time I've had him and he was really great. There was no final and the assignments throughout the semester all took me less than 30 min a week.

I LOVE every bit of Skott-Myhre's courses. He's a major Child and Youth Care academic in America and Canada, so he's legit. I took an online Maymester he taught and it was a lot of work of course but his expectations were clear, the schedule was easy to follow, and the material was interesting. He uses his own book so you have to read but it's okay

100% the best professor at KSU! I wish I could have taken him more. He challenges the traditional discourses of society and encourages differing viewpoints. You have to take him at least once! He gives you the space to think for yourself! Every class Ive had with him has been my favorite and his passion for people is seen in everything he does
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: TAKE HIM!! Think Divergent/conspiracy theorist. Elevates you to think on a higher level, which is what college is SUPPOSED to do. I learned SO much from him. He's very liberal while I'm more conservative,yet, I I STILL loved him so much I took him TWICE! Lecture heavy with great videos. Encourages class discussion. He sets the bar high!

For cultural competence he was great! He explained everything well. There are six 1-2 page papers every other week that are not bad. You will read them in groups and discuss them for a grade. And at the end of the semester there is a 3-5 page paper where you make up your own agency that is culturally competent. Great class, learned a lot!

You only have tests, a paper, and participation. No book. Powerpoints are only to get to you through. It's like 10 million slides then a test. You never know what's going to be on the test. He is a cool professor but be mindful and ask yourself if this is what you want lol.
Absolutely love this professor. Although make sure you take notes and come to class, he takes attendance seriously.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Really awesome professor. Made lectures so interesting. You don't need to textbook, come to class and take notes on his lectures, you won't want to miss them anyway, he is very engaging. Tests in computer lab during class, study your lecture notes and you'll make an easy A. Can't wait to take Hans again.

Hans is the BEST! He is real with his students and challenges you to think outside of social norms. Very easy to talk to and has a lot of knowledge of the Human Service field. Great guy and an interesting class. 4 quizzes (1 being midterm and 1 being Final) and a paper.

Hans is probably one of the best professors at KSU. He's smart as hell and might seem intimidating at first, but he's one of the easiest people to talk to. He loves when you ask questions about the material. Didn't use the book at all-- almost everything you need to know is from his lectures, which are pretty fascinating. Show up and take notes!

Great professor, incredibly nice and well spoken. Uploads all the power points on D2L and is easily accessible by email. Very understanding and creates an inclusive learning environment! Only one paper, some quizzes, no tests only the mid term and final.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This man is inspiring. Not gonna lie, you have to pay attention and you have to study, but welcome to college. Posts power points online, but attendance is mandatory. You learn so much about Human Services. He also is probably one of the coolest guys you'll ever meet. Anyone who says he sucks didn't come to class or try. He rocks!

Skott-Myhre is by far the best teacher I have ever taken. He will make you think outside of the box, and question everything you think you knew about working with children. Though his approach is non-traditional, you will leave learning so much more than what you bargained for!

By far the best professor I have ever taken. He is very intelligent and sometimes hard to follow but I have learned so much throughout his class. Not much graded work so it is important to be present. He is big on discussion.

Dr. Skott-Myhre is a great lecturer and will teach you a LOT about Human Services. He is hysterical and practical. You'll learn a lot about the HS field, but also a lot about yourself if you take the time to consider the material in the way it deserves. If you're not sure about a career in the HS field, take his class- I think he will convince you!

I looked forward to Professor Hans's lectures every single Monday for the entire semester. That should tell you how wonderfully constructed his lectures are, and they really make you think about life and human services. He gives an appropriate amount of grades, and easy to accomplish if you start early. Great class, and wonderful professor!

Hans was fantastic--made the material really interesting and was hilarious. He had so many interesting stories that I wanted to hear more of. Two quizzes, one final, one paper, and a "project" that was 20 hours of volunteering. He was super understanding to many students. I look forward to taking him in future classes!

Amazing! Only a few grades- 10% attendance, 20% quizzes (2 of them total, so 10% each), 20% paper about a service organization, 20% based on 20 community service hours, 10% Midterm, 20% Final. I had him 5:00-7:45 on Thursdays, 3 hour classes are always hard, but he tries to keep you engaged (and he does a great job), gives breaks and lets out early
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: You only have a few grades, but zero tests. A midterm paper, a final paper, attendance, a facilitation. Hans is really insightful though, and keeps you interested in the material!! My notes consisted of his own personal quotes.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS
